## File: news/news_2025-05-27.md

**FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE**

**Headline: BC Ostrich Farm Vows Appeal After Federal Court Upholds CFIA Cull Order for 400 Birds**

**EDGEWOOD, B.C. – May 27, 2025** – Universal Ostrich Farms Inc. is preparing to appeal a Federal Court decision that upheld the Canadian Food Inspection Agency's (CFIA) order to euthanize its flock of approximately 400 ostriches following an H5N1 avian influenza detection late last year. The May 13, 2025, ruling by Justice Russel Zinn found the CFIA's actions to be reasonable and procedurally fair based on the information available at the time of the initial orders.

The case, which has drawn significant public attention and even international governmental interest, pits the CFIA's mandate to control animal diseases and protect public health and trade against the farm owners' assertions of their flock's unique scientific value and current health.

The situation began in early December 2024 when Universal Ostrich Farms, a 65-acre operation in Edgewood, B.C., primarily managed by two principals with decades of experience, observed respiratory symptoms in some ostriches. This followed reported exposure to wild ducks (Decision, para [29]). After an anonymous tip about multiple ostrich deaths, the CFIA intervened on December 28, 2024, imposing a verbal quarantine (Decision, para [30]). Swab samples collected on December 30 from two carcasses tested positive for H5 avian influenza on December 31 (Decision, paras [31]-[32]). The CFIA issued a "Notice to Dispose" for the entire flock just 41 minutes later, citing its 2022 Event Response Plan (ERP) which operationalizes the "Stamping-Out Policy" (Decision, para [1], [33]).

Universal Ostrich Farms, which transitioned its focus around 2020 from meat production to research involving the extraction of immunoglobulin Y (antibodies) from ostrich eggs for potential human-virus diagnostics (Decision, para [13], [26]), applied for an exemption from depopulation. They argued the flock constituted a "distinct epidemiological unit" with "rare and valuable poultry genetics" (Decision, para [1], [49]). The farm owners also highlighted their long-standing selective breeding program dating back to the 1990s (Decision, para [13], [25]) and their belief that many ostriches had developed natural immunity after a previous illness in 2020 and the recent outbreak (Decision, para [28], [34]; website).

On January 10, 2025, the CFIA denied the exemption request, stating the farm failed to demonstrate a distinct unexposed unit and provided insufficient proof of genetic rarity or value under CFIA's criteria, which the agency's Exemption Committee felt required evidence like breeding books or genomic testing for recognized traits (Decision, para [1], [41], [56], [251]). The farm has maintained on its website, SaveOurOstriches.com, that the birds have been healthy for months since the last reported death on January 15, 2025 (Website; Decision, para [42]).

In his 152-page decision (2025 FC 878), Justice Zinn dismissed the farm's applications for judicial review. He emphasized that the court's role was not to re-decide the case but to assess the reasonableness and procedural fairness of the CFIA's decisions based on the record before the agency at the time (Decision, paras [3], [7]). He found the CFIA's Stamping-Out Policy to be reasonable and consistent with its mandate under the Health of Animals Act and international obligations (Decision, paras [67], [93], [169]).

Key arguments raised by the farm and addressed by Justice Zinn included:
*   **Procedural Fairness (Dr. French's Report):** The farm argued unfairness because the CFIA's Exemption Committee did not wait for a literature review on avian flu in ostriches it had commissioned on the morning of its January 10 decision. Justice Zinn found this was not a "fatal flaw" as the report, when later submitted, would not have altered the outcome (Decision, paras [233], [239], [241]).
*   **Application of Policy to Unique Flock:** The farm contended the CFIA unreasonably applied poultry-focused policies to their unique research ostriches. Justice Zinn upheld the CFIA's application, noting its broad discretion (Decision, paras [83]-[84], [194]).
*   **"Rare and Valuable Genetics" Exemption:** The CFIA, and subsequently Justice Zinn, found the farm did not provide sufficient proof under the policy's criteria (Decision, paras [56], [251]).
*   **Legitimate Expectation:** The farm argued communications from a CFIA Case Officer created a legitimate expectation regarding the exemption process. Justice Zinn found no "clear, unambiguous, and unqualified" representation that would create such an expectation for a specific outcome (Decision, para [217]-[224]).

The farm owners have announced their intention to appeal Justice Zinn's decision, according to their website.

Adding a new dimension to the case, a letter dated May 23, 2025, from high-ranking U.S. health officials, including the Secretary of Health and Human Services, was sent to the CFIA President. The letter respectfully requests the CFIA consider not culling the flock, citing "significant value in studying this population" for H5N1 natural history, immune longevity, and potential therapeutics. The U.S. officials offered support for long-term research on the ostriches and proposed collaboration on "more nuanced and thoughtful protocols" for controlling avian influenza outbreaks. (Source: `legal/rfk_letter.md`).

Further complicating the cull, the Regional District of Central Kootenay (RDCK) voted on May 15, 2025, to refuse the ostrich carcasses at its landfill until the CFIA re-tests the currently healthy birds and makes the results public (Source: `saveourostriches.com/news/rdck-votes-to-refuse-ostrich-carcasses-at-landfills-until-testing-updated/`).

The CFIA has consistently maintained that its actions are necessary to protect animal health, public health, and Canada's international trade status, aligning with WOAH guidelines. The court ruling also noted that the farm could be eligible for compensation up to $3,000 per ostrich under existing regulations (Decision, para [85], [271]).

The future of the Universal Ostrich Farms flock remains uncertain as legal proceedings continue and international scientific interest grows.

---
**References are to paragraph numbers in Justice Zinn's decision (2025 FC 878) or specific file names from the "Compiled Content" where the information originates.**
---

Her commanding presence and confidence make her a standout member of the herd.\n    \n*   ### [Help Save Anna](https://saveourostriches.com/ostriches/anna/)\n    \n    Meet Anna. She’s feisty, confident, and always full of attitude at Universal Ostrich Farms. With her cool demeanor and bold personality, Anna stands out among the flock, never afraid to show off her unique style and energy.\n    \n*   ### [Help Save Kickaroo](https://saveourostriches.com/ostriches/kickaroo/)\n    \n    Meet Kickaroo. Kickaroo is full of energy and when she gets very excited, she loves to kick her legs. Kickaroo’s lively spirit makes her a favourite at Universal Ostrich Farms. Always on the move, Kickaroo brings nonstop energy to the flock. Her playful kicks and vibrant personality make her a standout among the ostriches.\n    \n*   ### [Help Save Erica](https://saveourostriches.com/ostriches/erica/)\n    \n    Meet Erica. Erica is fiercely loyal to her family, and her dedication to their well-being makes her a key member of the farm. Kind and considerate, she’s known for looking out for others and offering a steady, reliable presence. Her strong, unwavering spirit ensures that everyone around her feels safe and supported.\n    \n*   ### [Help Save Arnold](https://saveourostriches.com/ostriches/arnold/)\n    \n    Meet Arnold, He’s healthy, happy, and loved by everyone at Universal Ostrich Farms. His wisdom and gentle nature make him a respected member of the herd.\n    \n*   ### [Help Save Bonnie](https://saveourostriches.com/ostriches/bonnie/)\n    \n    Meet Bonnie. She’s serious and a bit shy, but don’t let that fool you—Bonnie has plenty of attitude. Loyal and steadfast, she’s always there for her herd, keeping a watchful eye while quietly observing everything around her.\n    \n*   ### [Help Save Spike](https://saveourostriches.com/ostriches/spike/)\n    \n    Meet Spike. Tough and protective, he’s the kind of ostrich who makes sure nobody messes with the herd. With a no-nonsense attitude and a fierce loyalty, Spike’s always on guard, ready to stand up for those he cares about. If we make revisions that change the way we collect, use, or share personal information, we will post those changes in this Privacy Policy. You should review this Privacy Policy periodically so that you keep up to date on our most current policies and practices. We will note the effective date of the latest version of our Privacy Policy at the end of this Privacy Policy.\nPlease read this Privacy Policy carefully to understand UOF’s views and practices regarding your personal information and how we will treat it. By visiting this Platform, you are freely accepting and consenting to the practices in this Privacy Policy. You may withdraw your consent at any time and for any reason with effect to future data processing by contacting us to remove your account.\nCollection of Personal Information\nThrough your interactions with UOF, UOF collects “personal information,” which is information that identifies an individual or relates to an identified individual. Non-personal information means information that does not directly identify an individual. We collect both types of information about you.\nThe following provides some examples of the type of data that we collect from you:\nAccount Information\nWhen you create an Account and purchase access to training, we may collect your name, email address, contact information, billing address, and other Registration Information. Such information shall be associated with your Account, and you may update such information by editing the information associated with your Account.\nCookies\nYou will receive cookies from UOF that allow us to provide our services to you, such as to maintain the logged-in state of your account. We may also use suppliers that may also set cookies on your device on our behalf when you visit the UOF website to allow them to deliver the services they are providing.\nDevice Information\nWe may collect limited information about the type of device and screen that you are using, in order to better understand user demographics to better optimize our platform and services.\nUse of Personal Information\nIn addition to the uses described above, UOF uses the personal information collected in an effort to improve your experience, to provide services to you, and to communicate with you about information that you request. UOF may also use personal information to help target specific offers to you and to help UOF develop and improve its services. Additionally, UOF may use your personal information:\nTo identify you when you access and use the UOF Site.\nTo administer Accounts.\nTo provide services and content to our clients.\nTo provide you with products and services you request, or that maybe be of interest to you.\nTo streamline your checkout process.\nTo send marketing and promotional materials, including information relating to products, services, sales, or promotions.\nTo respond to your inquiries related to support, employment opportunities, or other requests.\nTo conduct research and analysis.\nFor internal administrative purposes, as well as to manage our relationship with you.\nSharing of Personal Information\nIn addition to the specific situations discussed elsewhere in this Privacy Policy, UOF may disclose personal information in the following situations:\nWe may ask if you would like us to share your information with other unaffiliated third parties who are not described elsewhere in this policy, and we may do so with your consent.\nWe may disclose personal information in response to subpoenas, warrants, or court orders, or in connection with any legal process, or to comply with relevant laws. We may also share your personal information in order to establish or exercise our rights, to defend against a legal claim, to investigate, prevent, or take action regarding possible illegal activities, suspected fraud, safety of person or property, or a violation of our Terms of Use, or to comply with your request for the shipment of products to or the provision of services by a third-party intermediary.\nA portion of the UOF Site may provide the opportunity to post comments, or reviews, in a public forum. If you decide to submit information at these locations, that information may be publicly available.\nSecurity of Personal Information\nUOF has implemented reasonable and appropriate security measures to help protect the personal information UOF collects from loss, misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, and destruction. Although UOF attempts to protect the personal information in its possession, no security system is perfect, and UOF cannot promise that your personal information will remain absolutely secure in all circumstances.\nRetention of Personal Information\nUOF will retain your personal information as needed to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected. UOF will retain and use your personal information as necessary to comply with UOF’s business requirements, legal obligations, resolve disputes, protect our assets, and enforce our agreements.\nData Integrity and Purpose Limitation\nUOF limits the use of personal information to ways that are compatible and relevant to the purposes for which the personal information was collected or subsequently authorized or for which consent was obtained. UOF will take reasonable steps to ensure that personal information is reliable for its intended use, accurate, complete, and current.\nYour Choices\nYou can make the following choices regarding your personal information by logging into the Email Notifications section in your UOF account:\nElectronic Communications. You may choose to consent to allowing us to send free UOF-specific newsletters, surveys, offers, and other promotional materials to you.\nChanges to Your Personal Information. We rely on you to update and correct your personal information. Note that we may keep historical information in our backup files as permitted by law. All requests to correct your information must be directed to the contact in the “Communications” section below.\nAccess to Your Personal Information. rel=\"alternate\"; title=\"JSON\"; type=\"application/json\", <https://saveourostriches.com/?p=9642>; rel=shortlink","etag":"\"6930-1747992583;br\"","x-litespeed-cache":"hit","content-encoding":"br","vary":"Accept-Encoding","content-length":"26635","date":"Tue, 27 May 2025 06:29:47 GMT","server":"LiteSpeed","platform":"hostinger","panel":"hpanel","content-security-policy":"upgrade-insecure-requests","x-firefox-spdy":"h2"}},"screenshotUrl":null,"text":"Bird Flu, Have Mercy - by Joel Salatin\nArticle by Joel Salatin, the Lunatic Farmer\nApr 3, 2025 – My post today originates form Edgewood, British Columbia, where Universal Ostrich Farms faces a Canadian government assault on their 300 healthy ostriches. Farm owner Katie Pasitney and her friend and sleuth Connie Shields have quite a tragic story. I’ve had two lengthy conversations with them and here is a synopsis of their plight.\nThe 400-ostrich farm switched from meat and eggs three years ago to a research facility collaborating with a Japanese scientist trying to develop covid 19 antigens. Their experiments yielded robust antigens in the egg yolks that were processed into nutraceuticals administered as a pill, lozenge, or nasal spray. It totally neutralized covid 19 without any injection. One week after the discovery, the Japanese lab was purchased and everything shut down. Interesting.\nIn 2022 the farm lost about 60 ostriches to a rare bacterial infection. But an amazing thing happened: they stopped dying and within a month, nothing was dying and all the droopy birds looked robust and healthy. Tissue samples confirmed that it was njot bird flu. Some 300 wild mallard ducks virtually live at the farm.\nThis past December, two ostriches died and an “anonymous informant” called the Canadian Food Inspection Agency to report a possible bird flu situation. Officials came, ran a PCR test on the carcasses that were 48 hours old, and discovered bird flu. Immediately the government put the farm under quarantine and demanded extermination of all the remaining 300 ostriches.\nBecause this farm has connections in the research community, it sent blood samples of the birds to a lab. Guess what? All the birds had antigens to bird flu. In fact, Katie, the farm owner, is carrying bird flu antigens in HER blood. The government didn’t like this testing, and threatened a $200,000 fine if they tested any more animals.\nAn extermination order Dec. 27, demanding that the farm kill all the antigen-carrying, healthy birds, demanded immediate responses. One option was to qualify for a “distinct unit exemption package.” Because the paperwork was written for commercial poultry operations, none of it applied to this special ostrich place. A “no” in any box meant automatic denial.\nRight now Katie and Connie and friends are desperate to save their birds. They’ve filed an injunction in the courts that will be heard April 15 and 16. The Judicial Review will determine if the Dec. 27 cull order can be overturned and to determine if an exemption request has merit.\nA tidbit that’s too strange to omit is that the main CFIA agent in charge of the case is “Case Worker 007.” You can’t make this stuff up.\nConnie’s sleuthing has turned up an interesting thing about the one Canadian farm that has received the unique exemption, meaning even with bird flu, they don’t have to kill the surviving healthy birds. Only one farm has ever been granted an exemption from bird flu extermination: Hybrid Turkey Farms on Mar. 27, 2022. It’s owned by Hendrix Genetics from the Netherlands. Remember my post from a few days ago noting that the Erasmus Medical Center in the Netherlands was one of the 3 labs doing gain-of-function research on bird flu, according to Dr. Peter McCullough.\nWho owns Hendrix? Paine Schwartz Partnership, which lists the Canadian Government as a partner. This outfit is doing Turkey Trac development, which injects trackers into eggs so a bird can be monitored for its whole life. Some 90 percent of turkeys eaten on Canadian tables come from Hendrix. What happens when you eat these tracking devices? Can someone track you?\nCFIA officials have told Katie, the ostrich farmer “every outdoor animal poses a risk because it’s exposed to migratory birds.” The ostrich farm has been completely bird flu symptom free now for 90 days and counting. The birds have the antigens. They’re healthy. But the government agents have one goal: kill everything.\nOn the zoom calls with me, Katie sobs for her birds and the stress she’s under. What’s crazy is that as soon as all their birds are killed, they can repopulate with new birds, according to the government. “What are they going to do about the 300 mallard ducks?” Katie asks. Nothing, of course. The CFIA agents laugh at the question, she notes.\nFolks, this is outrageous. Here we have documented examples of immunological adaptation and nature’s antigen wisdom, but government agents show positive symptoms for insanity. I’m relaying this story to the best of my ability the way Katie the farmer told it to me. My heart breaks for her and I told her I would try to get her story out to a wider audience. Have mercy.\nIf you want to help Katie hang onto her birds and farm, you can do it by going to www.saveourostriches.com.\nWhat would you do if government agents told you to kill your healthy birds?\nShare This Story:\nFacebook\n\"Bird Flu, Have Mercy\" Joel Salatin on our farm...","markdown":"# Bird Flu, Have Mercy - by Joel Salatin\n\n[![](https://saveourostriches.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/image-3.png)](https://www.thelunaticfarmer.com/)\n\nArticle by [**Joel Salatin, the Lunatic Farmer**](https://www.thelunaticfarmer.com/blog/4/3/2025/bird-flu-have-mercy)\n\n**Apr 3, 2025** – My post today originates form Edgewood, British Columbia, where Universal Ostrich Farms faces a Canadian government assault on their 300 healthy ostriches.  Farm owner Katie Pasitney and her friend and sleuth Connie Shields have quite a tragic story.  I’ve had two lengthy conversations with them and here is a synopsis of their plight.\n\nThe 400-ostrich farm switched from meat and eggs  three years ago to a research facility collaborating with a Japanese scientist trying to develop covid 19 antigens.  Their experiments yielded robust antigens in the egg yolks that were processed into nutraceuticals administered as a pill, lozenge, or nasal spray.  It totally neutralized covid 19 without any injection.  One week after the discovery, the Japanese lab was purchased and everything shut down. Interesting.\n\nIn 2022 the farm lost about 60 ostriches to a rare bacterial infection.  But an amazing thing happened:  they stopped dying and within a month, nothing was dying and all the droopy birds looked robust and healthy.  Tissue samples confirmed that it was njot bird flu.  Some 300 wild mallard ducks virtually live at the farm.\n\nThis past December, two ostriches died and an “anonymous informant” called the Canadian Food Inspection Agency to report a possible bird flu situation.  Officials came, ran a PCR test on the carcasses that were 48 hours old, and discovered bird flu.  Immediately the government put the farm under quarantine and demanded extermination of all the remaining 300 ostriches.\n\nBecause this farm has connections in the research community, it sent blood samples of the birds to a lab.  Guess what?  All the birds had antigens to bird flu.  In fact, Katie, the farm owner, is carrying bird flu antigens in HER blood.  The government didn’t like this testing, and threatened a $200,000 fine if they tested any more animals.\n\nAn extermination order Dec. 27, demanding that the farm kill all the antigen-carrying, healthy birds, demanded immediate responses.  One option was to qualify for a “distinct unit exemption package.”  Because the paperwork was written for commercial poultry operations, none of it applied to this special ostrich place.  A “no” in any box meant automatic denial.\n\nRight now Katie and Connie and friends are desperate to save their birds.  They’ve filed an injunction in the courts that will be heard April 15 and 16.  The Judicial Review will determine if the Dec. 27 cull order can be overturned and to determine if an exemption request has merit.\n\nA tidbit that’s too strange to omit is that the main CFIA agent in charge of the case is “Case Worker 007.”  You can’t make this stuff up.\n\nConnie’s sleuthing has turned up an interesting thing about the one Canadian farm that has received the unique exemption, meaning even with bird flu, they don’t have to kill the surviving healthy birds. Only one farm has ever been granted an exemption from bird flu extermination:  Hybrid Turkey Farms on Mar. 27, 2022.  It’s owned by Hendrix Genetics from the Netherlands.  Remember my post from a few days ago noting that the Erasmus Medical Center in the Netherlands was one of the 3 labs doing gain-of-function research on bird flu, according to Dr. Peter McCullough.\n\nWho owns Hendrix?  Paine Schwartz Partnership, which lists the Canadian Government as a partner.  This outfit is doing Turkey Trac development, which injects trackers into eggs so a bird can be monitored for its whole life.  Some 90 percent of turkeys eaten on Canadian tables come from Hendrix.  What happens when you eat these tracking devices? Can someone track you?\n\nCFIA officials have told Katie, the ostrich farmer “every outdoor animal poses a risk because it’s exposed to migratory birds.”  The ostrich farm has been completely bird flu symptom free now for 90 days and counting.  The birds have the antigens.  They’re healthy.  But the government agents have one goal:  kill everything.\n\nOn the zoom calls with me, Katie sobs for her birds and the stress she’s under.  What’s crazy is that as soon as all their birds are killed, they can repopulate with new birds, according to the government.  “What are they going to do about the 300 mallard ducks?” Katie asks.  Nothing, of course.  The CFIA agents laugh at the question, she notes.\n\nFolks, this is outrageous.  Here we have documented examples of immunological adaptation and nature’s antigen wisdom, but government agents show positive symptoms for insanity. I’m relaying this story to the best of my ability the way Katie the farmer told it to me.  My heart breaks for her and I told her I would try to get her story out to a wider audience.  Have mercy.\n\nIf you want to help Katie hang onto her birds and farm, you can do it by going to [www.saveourostriches.com](https://bcrising.ca/save-our-ostriches/?fbclid=IwY2xjawJbbl9leHRuA2FlbQIxMAABHRkI38f228a1sCR-36zvQWjseh_tw9NETqKuAQtVE-Cym8UHPeyC34OGUw_aem_V5sWbmQg2pNXYkQ4by5SYA).\n\nWhat would you do if government agents told you to kill your healthy birds?\n\n## Share This Story:\n\nFacebook\n\n[![](https://static.xx.fbcdn.net/rsrc.php/v4/ye/r/rI2wufhmEzc.png)](https://saveourostriches.com/SaveOurOstriches/posts/122119993028772897?ref=embed_post)\n\n\"Bird Flu, Have Mercy\" Joel Salatin on our farm...","debug":{"requestHandlerMode":"browser"}}

rel=\"alternate\"; title=\"JSON\"; type=\"application/json\", <https://saveourostriches.com/?p=10442>; rel=shortlink","etag":"\"6907-1747985226;br\"","x-litespeed-cache":"hit","content-encoding":"br","vary":"Accept-Encoding","content-length":"26826","date":"Tue, 27 May 2025 06:29:47 GMT","server":"LiteSpeed","platform":"hostinger","panel":"hpanel","content-security-policy":"upgrade-insecure-requests","x-firefox-spdy":"h2"}},"screenshotUrl":null,"text":"April 15, 2025 - Judicial Review Update (Day 1)\nKatie Pasitney from Universal Ostrich Farms \nDay 1 of the Judicial Review @ 701 West Georgia Street, Vancouver BC.\nKatie provides an update from Federal Court, where the case of Universal Ostrich Farms against the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) is underway.\nGood morning everybody. We are here and we are ready, so thank you for everybody’s love and support. We’re all checked in, waiting in the breakout room for court to start, and just continued prayers and lots of love through today. Let’s just pray that truth and science gets heard today and holds a place in our judicial system and is protected. Hi everybody we’re just here, we’re ready, and lots of love. We’ll let you know how everything goes.\nCourtroom Notes provided by Kari Simpson\nUpdate #1\nOstrich warrior and lawyer, Michael Carter was the first to address the court.\nIn his address Mr. Carter presented a concise record of the events leading up to the decision by CFIA. He exposed a number of failings by the CFIA to follow its own policies.\n(Writer’s comments- Most interesting was how the ostriches were found to have a variant of the Avian flu and how the so-called CFIA experts refused to answer questions during the discovery process because they weren’t qualified!!)\nUpdate #2\nSave Our Ostriches warrior lawyer Michael Carter gave the opening statements on behalf of the ostrich farm.\nMr. Carter, provided a concise account of the events leading up to the decision by CFIA to kill the ostriches.\nIt was obvious from the record that CFIA didn’t follow its own guidelines. Most important were the statements made by CFIA “experts” involving the identified variant of Avian flu, found by the testing. CFIA experts admitted during the discovery process that they weren’t qualified to respond to questions about the variants transmission.\nUpdate #3\nJust before the morning break, lawyer Lee Turner took over from Michael Carter.\nMr. Turner turned the focus onto how the CFIA failed to properly address the new emerging variant.\nUsing the World Health Organization Animals (WHOA) directives to member countries on what should be done it was obvious that the CFIA didn’t follow the directives.\nAs Canada follows and relies on WHOA, Mr. Turned used their definition of “poultry” to demonstrate to the judge that these ostriches did not fall into the guidelines associated with poultry.\nMorning break.\nUpdate #4\n11:26 am court resumes after morning break. Lee Turner describes for the court how negligent the CFIA was in dealing with the new variant.\nReferring to CFIA’s own vet, Cathy Furness, affidavit where she acknowledges that the test results from the 2 dead ostriches showed a unique reassortment of genome type not identified before in Canada, Mr. Turner again detailed what the CFIAs responsibilities were and that they failed to meet those requirements. Including testing, monitoring and research.\nUpdate 5\nLawyer Lee Turner took time to address Justice Zinn’s earlier questions about expert witnesses, qualifications and concerns about one of CFIAs affiants who made statements of opinion without being qualified as an expert.\nSome exchanges with the Justice and referenced discussion regarding precedent cases.\nMichael Carter will be back presenting after the lunch break.\nCourt will resume at 1:20 pm\nUpdate 6\nThe judicial review hearings continues. Lawyer Michael Carter, raises the numerous flaws in the CFIA decision making. With regard to the December 31, 2024 cull order the evidence shows that the decision by CFIA was “fatally flawed.”\nReferring to the sworn affidavits by CFIA it is clear that CFIA agents making the decisions didn’t have all the information! Dr. Fuentes’s confirms the only information they relied upon was the lab report from Abbotsford.\nUpdate 7\nLawyer Michael Carter navigates the mixed orders fiasco with Justice Zinn.\nOn Jan 2, 2025, CFIA gives the ostrich farm an exemption based on the valuable and rare genetics the ostriches possess. CFIA asks the owners to provide more information. CFIA doesn’t inform owners what info they need and gives them a form that is used for a commercial poultry farm. This firm isn’t applicable to the ostrich farm.\nOn January 10, the farm owners are then informed that their exemption has been REVOKED! No explanation, just orders to kill the ostriches by Feb 1.\nCarter also informs the court that CFIA has a policy of being transparent but failed to provide information as to why they changed their decision about the rare and valuable gentics.\nJustice Zinn is engaged. Doesn’t miss a word, including ones that are mis-spoken.\nUpdate 8\nCourt is over for today\nLawyer Michael Carter finished his submissions by informing the judge that the CFIA has discretion. Decision should be flexible, reflect scientific considerations…\nDiscussion then turned to vaccinations and both CFIA and WHOA agree that immunity is the goal.\nIssues around trade agreements clearly reflected that CFIAs reliance on using trade as an affected aspect was bogus. The CFIAs affiant swore that he had no knowledge of any trade deals being broken due to Avian flu.\n“CFIA’s statement that trade is affected is not true.”\nCarter finished his submissions and the taxpayer funded CFIA lawyer began her submissions calling the definition if poultry and the low pathogen designation a “Red Herring”.\nJudge questioned her on how she got to the designation of the tested virus being “highly pathogenic?” She responded by referring to a number of statements that didn’t make it “crystal clear.”\nDiscussions around the poultry designations also included what was happening at the farm and if it exceeded “research”.\nCourt ended with more to come tomorrow morning at 9:30 am.\nShare This Story\nFacebook \n<iframe src=\"https://www.facebook.com/plugins/video.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FSaveOurOstriches%2Fvideos%2F1226548435725063%2F%3Fref%3Dembed_video&show_text=0&width=267\" width=\"267\" height=\"476\" style=\"border:none;overflow:hidden\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"true\" allow=\"autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; picture-in-picture; web-share\" allowFullScreen=\"true\"></iframe>\nLearn more about embedding Facebook videos on our developer site.\nVideo Unavailable\nSorry, this video could not be played.","markdown":"# April 15, 2025 - Judicial Review Update (Day 1)\n\n**Katie Pasitney from Universal Ostrich Farms**\n\nDay 1 of the Judicial Review @ 701 West Georgia Street, Vancouver BC.\n\nKatie provides an update from Federal Court, where the case of Universal Ostrich Farms against the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) is underway.\n\n> Good morning everybody. We are here and we are ready, so thank you for everybody’s love and support. We’re all checked in, waiting in the breakout room for court to start, and just continued prayers and lots of love through today. Let’s just pray that truth and science gets heard today and holds a place in our judicial system and is protected. Hi everybody we’re just here, we’re ready, and lots of love. We’ll let you know how everything goes.\n\n* * *\n\n## Courtroom Notes provided by Kari Simpson\n\n## ![🌟](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/15.1.0/svg/1f31f.svg) Update #1\n\nOstrich warrior and lawyer, Michael Carter was the first to address the court.\n\nIn his address Mr. Carter presented a concise record of the events leading up to the decision by CFIA. He exposed a number of failings by the CFIA to follow its own policies.\n\n_(Writer’s comments- Most interesting was how the ostriches were found to have a variant of the Avian flu and how the so-called CFIA experts refused to answer questions during the discovery process because they weren’t qualified!!)_\n\n* * *\n\n## ![🌟](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/15.1.0/svg/1f31f.svg) Update #2\n\nSave Our Ostriches warrior lawyer Michael Carter gave the opening statements on behalf of the ostrich farm.\n\nMr. Carter, provided a concise account of the events leading up to the decision by CFIA to kill the ostriches.\n\nIt was obvious from the record that CFIA didn’t follow its own guidelines. Most important were the statements made by CFIA “experts” involving the identified variant of Avian flu, found by the testing. CFIA experts admitted during the discovery process that they weren’t qualified to respond to questions about the variants transmission.\n\n* * *\n\n## ![🌟](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/15.1.0/svg/1f31f.svg) Update #3\n\nJust before the morning break, lawyer Lee Turner took over from Michael Carter.\n\nMr. Turner turned the focus onto how the CFIA failed to properly address the new emerging variant.\n\nUsing the World Health Organization Animals (WHOA) directives to member countries on what should be done it was obvious that the CFIA didn’t follow the directives.\n\nAs Canada follows and relies on WHOA, Mr. Turned used their definition of “poultry” to demonstrate to the judge that these ostriches did not fall into the guidelines associated with poultry.\n\nMorning break.\n\n* * *\n\n![🌟](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/15.1.0/svg/1f31f.svg) **Update #4**\n\n11:26 am court resumes after morning break. Lee Turner describes for the court how negligent the CFIA was in dealing with the new variant.\n\nReferring to CFIA’s own vet, Cathy Furness, affidavit where she acknowledges that the test results from the 2 dead ostriches showed a unique reassortment of genome type not identified before in Canada, Mr. Turner again detailed what the CFIAs responsibilities were and that they failed to meet those requirements. Including testing, monitoring and research.\n\n* * *\n\n## ![🌟](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/15.1.0/svg/1f31f.svg) Update 5\n\nLawyer Lee Turner took time to address Justice Zinn’s earlier questions about expert witnesses, qualifications and concerns about one of CFIAs affiants who made statements of opinion without being qualified as an expert.\n\nSome exchanges with the Justice and referenced discussion regarding precedent cases.\n\nMichael Carter will be back presenting after the lunch break.\n\nCourt will resume at 1:20 pm\n\n* * *\n\n## ![🌟](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/15.1.0/svg/1f31f.svg) **Update 6**\n\nThe judicial review hearings continues. Lawyer Michael Carter, raises the numerous flaws in the CFIA decision making. With regard to the December 31, 2024 cull order the evidence shows that the decision by CFIA was “fatally flawed.”\n\nReferring to the sworn affidavits by CFIA it is clear that CFIA agents making the decisions didn’t have all the information! Dr. Fuentes’s confirms the only information they relied upon was the lab report from Abbotsford.\n\n* * *\n\n## ![🌟](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/15.1.0/svg/1f31f.svg) **Update 7**\n\nLawyer Michael Carter navigates the mixed orders fiasco with Justice Zinn.\n\nOn Jan 2, 2025, CFIA gives the ostrich farm an exemption based on the valuable and rare genetics the ostriches possess. CFIA asks the owners to provide more information. CFIA doesn’t inform owners what info they need and gives them a form that is used for a commercial poultry farm. This firm isn’t applicable to the ostrich farm.\n\nOn January 10, the farm owners are then informed that their exemption has been REVOKED! No explanation, just orders to kill the ostriches by Feb 1.\n\nCarter also informs the court that CFIA has a policy of being transparent but failed to provide information as to why they changed their decision about the rare and valuable gentics.\n\nJustice Zinn is engaged. Doesn’t miss a word, including ones that are mis-spoken.\n\n* * *\n\n## ![🌟](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/15.1.0/svg/1f31f.svg) **Update 8**\n\nCourt is over for today\n\nLawyer Michael Carter finished his submissions by informing the judge that the CFIA has discretion. Decision should be flexible, reflect scientific considerations…\n\nDiscussion then turned to vaccinations and both CFIA and WHOA agree that immunity is the goal.\n\nIssues around trade agreements clearly reflected that CFIAs reliance on using trade as an affected aspect was bogus. The CFIAs affiant swore that he had no knowledge of any trade deals being broken due to Avian flu.\n\n_“CFIA’s statement that trade is affected is not true.”_\n\nCarter finished his submissions and the taxpayer funded CFIA lawyer began her submissions calling the definition if poultry and the low pathogen designation a “Red Herring”.\n\nJudge questioned her on how she got to the designation of the tested virus being “highly pathogenic?” She responded by referring to a number of statements that didn’t make it “crystal clear.”\n\nDiscussions around the poultry designations also included what was happening at the farm and if it exceeded “research”.\n\nCourt ended with more to come tomorrow morning at 9:30 am.\n\n## Share This Story\n\nFacebook\n\n![](https://scontent-det1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t15.5256-10/491280409_1965264797616070_6453965488234413017_n.jpg?_nc_cat=101&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=442ec5&_nc_ohc=OLN5VBUaZGoQ7kNvwFI9DrF&_nc_oc=AdnNoZCcfoOyUMVIQx1lyJhFtENHhEIiA-q9kyt_OaUUNLWxXBof_JngjcMwsos3MsU&_nc_zt=23&_nc_ht=scontent-det1-1.xx&edm=AGo2L-IEAAAA&_nc_gid=LfAWqCCx0zKRpShLKuPxrA&oh=00_AfKvYLHDDAl1PkUdJhbwW_1cfE2TCNBq_EU2hrsWAcZVzw&oe=683B31C6)\n\n[\n\n![](https://scontent-det1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.30808-1/476745112_122093157644772897_1449603359353336363_n.jpg?stp=dst-jpg_s160x160_tt6&_nc_cat=110&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f907e8&_nc_ohc=w0tbyxCHRnMQ7kNvwEfzKRx&_nc_oc=AdlmMvxwx4MSnColbnW6BEo5xLvWCMpigAfyRNFtdh0Ztrka-te-0spwjn0n3_PnHAg&_nc_zt=24&_nc_ht=scontent-det1-1.xx&edm=AGo2L-IEAAAA&_nc_gid=LfAWqCCx0zKRpShLKuPxrA&oh=00_AfK1UrZC0APnG5mwSucWiJS0SuKmXH5BqJwqzty41R6pjg&oe=683B358F)\n\n](https://saveourostriches.com/watch/SaveOurOstriches/?ref=embed_video)\n\n<iframe Klaudia Van Emmerik reports.\n0 seconds of 0 secondsVolume 90%\nGlobal News, by Klaudia Van Emmerik\nPosted April 15, 2025 7:30 pm\nThey live on a farm near Edgewood, B.C., in the West Kootenay region, but the fate of 400 ostriches is now being decided in a federal courtroom in Vancouver.\nA two-day judicial hearing got underway Tuesday morning after the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) ordered the entire herd be culled following an avian flu outbreak in December.\n“Emotions have been high and it’s been a long road,” said Katie Pasitney of Universal Ostrich Farm. “We do believe…truth and science are going to be heard and we’re fighting for the agricultural industry.”\nThe outbreak is believed to have come from a flock of ducks that migrated to the farm.\nNearly 70 ostriches died as a result of the outbreak.\nAccording to the farm owners, they lost about 10 per cent of their flock.\nAt Tuesday’s judicial hearing, lawyers for Universal Ostrich Farm stated there has been no sign of illness at the farm since Jan. 15.\nThe CFIA’s cull order had a deadline of Feb. 1, but farm owners challenged it and in January received a reprieve from a federal judge pending a judicial review of the case.\n“We think CFIA basically applied a default position to these ostriches when they have been infected with a hybrid disease, not a typical HPAI virus,” said Kelowna-based lawyer Lee Turner. “The policies were not properly followed or understood.”\nThe case has garnered widespread attention, with supporters calling on the government to review the way it handles outbreaks so that animals aren’t unnecessarily killed.\n“This affects all of us. This is our food security, and with our food security, I think we all need to take a stand,” said Pasitney.\nThe ostriches are part of a program researching antibody production against the avian flu pandemic, which has been wiping out entire chicken farms.\nTurner said losing the ostriches comes at cost, potentially a missed opportunity to find a cure for other birds infected by the disease.\n“They’re learning a lot from their antibodies and their immune systems,” Turner told Global News. “And so I think we would lose that. We would also have a dangerous precedent for other farmers and ranchers and I think it poses a real threat to the agricultural industry in Canada.”\nIn addition to saving the ostriches, Pasitney said the fight is to prompt changes to government policies and implement other measures instead of only relying on a single and immediate ‘stamping out’ order.\n“They’re supposed to evolve and we just want to make the appropriate changes that would bring forth positive outcomes for others that are in the same fight,” Pasitney said.\nThe judicial review will continue on Wednesday.\nShare This Story\nTwitter Embed\nFuture of 400 B.C. ostriches being decided in federal court room Show more\nThere’s a new version of this Tweet","markdown":"# Future of 400 B.C. ostriches being decided in federal court room - Global News\n\nA controversial order to cull a flock of ostriches at a West Kootenay B.C. farm is now the  \nsubject of a judicial review in federal court.\n\nGlobal Player   \n\nB.C. ostrich farm cull under judicial review\n\nA controversial order to cull a flock of ostriches at a West Kootenay B.C. farm is now the subject of a judicial review in federal court. Klaudia Van Emmerik reports.\n\n0 seconds of 0 secondsVolume 90%\n\n**[Global News](https://globalnews.ca/news/11133651/future-400-bc-ostriches-federal-court/)**, by [Klaudia Van Emmerik](https://globalnews.ca/author/klaudia-ceglarz/)\n\nPosted April 15, 2025 7:30 pm\n\nThey live on a farm near Edgewood, B.C., in the West Kootenay region, but the fate of 400 ostriches is now being decided in a federal courtroom in Vancouver.\n\nA two-day judicial hearing got underway Tuesday morning after the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) ordered the entire herd be culled following an avian flu outbreak in December.\n\n“Emotions have been high and it’s been a long road,” said Katie Pasitney of Universal Ostrich Farm. “We do believe…truth and science are going to be heard and we’re fighting for the agricultural industry.”\n\nThe outbreak is believed to have come from a flock of ducks that migrated to the farm.\n\nNearly 70 ostriches died as a result of the outbreak.\n\nAccording to the farm owners, they lost about 10 per cent of their flock.\n\nAt Tuesday’s judicial hearing, lawyers for Universal Ostrich Farm stated there has been no sign of illness at the farm since Jan. 15.\n\nThe CFIA’s cull order had a deadline of Feb. 1, but farm owners challenged it and in January received a reprieve from a federal judge pending a judicial review of the case.\n\n“We think CFIA basically applied a default position to these ostriches when they have been infected with a  hybrid disease, not a typical HPAI virus,” said Kelowna-based lawyer Lee Turner.  “The policies were not properly followed or understood.”\n\n![Click to play video: 'B.C. ostrich farm owners challenging cull order'](https://i0.wp.com/media.globalnews.ca/videostatic/news/km5i3otwy-99baxepx45/web_still_5P_KEL_CFIA_OSTRICH_CUL_OM015TOS.jpg?w=1040&quality=70&strip=all)\n\nThe case has garnered widespread attention, with supporters calling on the government to review the way it handles outbreaks so that animals aren’t unnecessarily killed.\n\n“This affects all of us. This is our food security, and with our food security, I think we all need to take a stand,” said Pasitney.\n\nThe ostriches are part of a program researching antibody production against the avian flu pandemic, which has been wiping out entire chicken farms.\n\nTurner said losing the ostriches comes at cost, potentially a missed opportunity to find a cure for other birds infected by the disease.\n\n“They’re learning a lot from their antibodies and their immune systems,” Turner told Global News. “And so I think we would lose that. We would also have a dangerous precedent for other farmers and ranchers and I think it poses a real threat to the agricultural industry in Canada.”\n\nIn addition to saving the ostriches, Pasitney said the fight is to prompt changes to government policies and implement other measures instead of only relying on a single and immediate ‘stamping out’ order.\n\n“They’re supposed to evolve and we just want to make the appropriate changes that would bring forth positive outcomes for others that are in the same fight,” Pasitney said.\n\nThe judicial review will continue on Wednesday.\n\n## Share This Story\n\nTwitter Embed\n\n[](https://twitter.com/OstrichFarmBC/status/1913486389318222289?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1913471585392169459%7Ctwgr%5E2036af0f37ef07a0e0643b3110fcde18d6c4863f%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fsaveourostriches.com%2Fnews%2Ffuture-400-bc-ostriches-federal-court%2F)\n\nFuture of 400 B.C. ostriches being decided in federal court room [Show more](https://mobile.twitter.com/OstrichFarmBC/status/1913471585392169459?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1913471585392169459%7Ctwgr%5E2036af0f37ef07a0e0643b3110fcde18d6c4863f%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fsaveourostriches.com%2Fnews%2Ffuture-400-bc-ostriches-federal-court%2F)\n\nThere’s a new version of this Tweet","debug":{"requestHandlerMode":"browser"}}

That does come at a cost and so I’m really trying to just make this impact reach further.\n\nWe need to stand up and rise up as poultry industries, the dairy industry, the cattle industry, the bovine industry. The farm, which has been raising ostriches for 35 years, is facing a crisis due to a government order to cull over 400 ostriches amid an avian flu outbreak, despite most birds showing resistance and antibodies to the virus.\nKatie explains that the farm has shifted focus in recent years to groundbreaking antibody research in collaboration with Kyoto Prefectural University in Japan. They inoculate ostriches with antigens to produce robust antibodies in their egg yolks, which could be used to create nutraceuticals like lozenges and nasal sprays to boost human immunity against diseases, including COVID-19 variants. This research has shown promising results, with one ostrich egg containing antibodies equivalent to 100 chicken eggs or the blood of 800 rabbits, offering a humane and efficient alternative.\nThe crisis began in December 2024 when the farm noticed symptoms similar to a 2020 pseudomonas bacteria outbreak, initially linked to migratory mallard ducks. However, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA), acting on an anonymous tip, tested two deceased ostriches and confirmed H5N1 avian influenza using PCR tests, rejecting the farm’s request to test healthy birds or conduct a broader study. Despite the farm’s isolation and the ostriches’ apparent herd immunity—evidenced by 76 days without symptomatic deaths post-quarantine—the CFIA ordered the entire flock’s destruction, citing trading partner policies influenced by the World Health Organization and the UN.\nKatie highlights the farm’s struggle against what she calls a “stamping out” policy that prioritizes mass culling over preserving natural immunity, potentially benefiting Big Pharma by eliminating alternatives to vaccines. The CFIA has threatened a $250,000 fine or jail time if the farm tests its own animals, and even probed for intellectual property during a 5.5-hour meeting, despite having already signed a kill order on December 30, 2024. The family faces a deadline to kill and bury the ostriches themselves or lose compensation if a third-party contractor intervenes.\nWith a judicial review scheduled for mid-April, the farm is fighting legally to save their ostriches and research, having raised over $60,000 for legal fees but facing $100,000 more in outstanding costs. Katie pleads for public support, emphasizing the global implications for agriculture and natural immunity, and directs listeners to saveourostiches.com for updates and donations.\nChrissy underscores the story’s urgency, calling for action against government overreach and the preservation of this potentially revolutionary science, urging listeners to share the episode and support the cause.\nLearn more about this cause at https://bcrising.ca/save-our-ostriches/ and give to the cause at https://www.givesendgo.com/save-our-ostriches or https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-ostrich-farmers-fight-to-save-herd-from-avian-flu\nShare This Story:\nTwitter Embed\nImagine a world where a family farm’s 400 ostriches—resilient, healthy & key to revolutionary antibody research—are ordered to be destroyed despite showing natural immunity to avian flu. This isn’t a hypothetical—it’s happening right now. LISTEN HERE - buff.ly/LaoJmOK","markdown":"# Ostrich Antibodies & Avian Flu: Is Science Being Ignored?\n\n[**North American Ag**](https://www.northamericanag.com/post/ostrich-antibodies-avian-flu-is-science-being-ignored), Season 5: Episode 207\n\nApr 3, 2025 – In this North American Ag Spotlight podcast episode, host Chrissy Wozniak interviews Katie Pasitney from [Universal Ostrich](https://www.givesendgo.com/save-our-ostriches), a family-owned ostrich farm in British Columbia, Canada. The farm, which has been raising ostriches for 35 years, is facing a crisis due to a government order to cull over 400 ostriches amid an avian flu outbreak, despite most birds showing resistance and antibodies to the virus.\n\nKatie explains that the farm has shifted focus in recent years to groundbreaking antibody research in collaboration with Kyoto Prefectural University in Japan. They inoculate ostriches with antigens to produce robust antibodies in their egg yolks, which could be used to create nutraceuticals like lozenges and nasal sprays to boost human immunity against diseases, including COVID-19 variants. This research has shown promising results, with one ostrich egg containing antibodies equivalent to 100 chicken eggs or the blood of 800 rabbits, offering a humane and efficient alternative.\n\nThe crisis began in December 2024 when the farm noticed symptoms similar to a 2020 pseudomonas bacteria outbreak, initially linked to migratory mallard ducks. However, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA), acting on an anonymous tip, tested two deceased ostriches and confirmed H5N1 avian influenza using PCR tests, rejecting the farm’s request to test healthy birds or conduct a broader study. Despite the farm’s isolation and the ostriches’ apparent herd immunity—evidenced by 76 days without symptomatic deaths post-quarantine—the CFIA ordered the entire flock’s destruction, citing trading partner policies influenced by the World Health Organization and the UN.\n\nKatie highlights the farm’s struggle against what she calls a “stamping out” policy that prioritizes mass culling over preserving natural immunity, potentially benefiting Big Pharma by eliminating alternatives to vaccines. The CFIA has threatened a $250,000 fine or jail time if the farm tests its own animals, and even probed for intellectual property during a 5.5-hour meeting, despite having already signed a kill order on December 30, 2024. The family faces a deadline to kill and bury the ostriches themselves or lose compensation if a third-party contractor intervenes.\n\nWith a judicial review scheduled for mid-April, the farm is fighting legally to save their ostriches and research, having raised over $60,000 for legal fees but facing $100,000 more in outstanding costs. Katie pleads for public support, emphasizing the global implications for agriculture and natural immunity, and directs listeners to [saveourostiches.com](http://saveourostiches.com/) for updates and donations.\n\nChrissy underscores the story’s urgency, calling for action against government overreach and the preservation of this potentially revolutionary science, urging listeners to share the episode and support the cause.\n\nLearn more about this cause at [https://bcrising.ca/save-our-ostriches/](https://bcrising.ca/save-our-ostriches/) and give to the cause at [https://www.givesendgo.com/save-our-ostriches](https://www.givesendgo.com/save-our-ostriches) or [https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-ostrich-farmers-fight-to-save-herd-from-avian-flu](https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-ostrich-farmers-fight-to-save-herd-from-avian-flu?attribution_id=sl%3A80e09934-7413-429b-acfb-2f7015cc19d3&lang=en_CA)\n\n## Share This Story:\n\nTwitter Embed\n\n[](https://twitter.com/NorthAmericaAg/status/1907804536409903424?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1907804536409903424%7Ctwgr%5Ea142992026d80f7f5589d964488bf3251d50c0df%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fsaveourostriches.com%2Fpodcasts%2Fostrich-antibodies-avian-flu-is-science-being-ignored%2F)\n\nImagine a world where a family farm’s 400 ostriches—resilient, healthy & key to revolutionary antibody research—are ordered to be destroyed despite showing natural immunity to avian flu. This isn’t a hypothetical—it’s happening right now. rel=\"alternate\"; title=\"JSON\"; type=\"application/json\", <https://saveourostriches.com/?p=10215>; rel=shortlink","etag":"\"6942-1747996860;br\"","x-litespeed-cache":"hit","content-encoding":"br","vary":"Accept-Encoding","content-length":"24980","date":"Tue, 27 May 2025 06:31:19 GMT","server":"LiteSpeed","platform":"hostinger","panel":"hpanel","content-security-policy":"upgrade-insecure-requests","x-firefox-spdy":"h2"}},"screenshotUrl":null,"text":"Mar 6, 2025 Update From the Farm\nMarch 6 Herd Immunity is a pretty thing - YouTube\nURGENT UPDATE – OUR FIGHT FOR JUSTICE CONTINUES\nWe are in the fight of a century to protect our farm (research facility), our animals and the future of farming. The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) is not only pushing for mass culling of our healthy Ostriches (that is based only on 2 PCR tests December 30th) but have continued to threaten us with a $200,000 fine and/ or 6 months in jail if we pursued with 3rd party testing.\nThis is a direct attack on transparency and science.\nCRITICAL POINTS YOU NEED TO KNOW:\nOnly 2 PCR Test: CFIA has only conducted two PCR tests and refuse to re-test our animals despite 51 days of clear health and herd immunity\n65 Days in Quarantine: Our Ostriches have remained healthy for nearly 2 months, proving that natural immunity is working\nMass culling is not the answer: The “stamping out” policy that CFIA is relying on to make these decisions is based on outdated trading partner policies that do nothing t advance animal or human health. What the policy IS DOING is wiping out natural immunity, which is the natural resistance and would lead to infectious diseases spreading faster with more devastating effects. No natural immunity in animals would set off a chain reaction leading t the breakdown of ecosystems, food webs, and even human survival.\nH5N1 is being spread by migratory birds: This virus is being carried across Canada and the world by migratory birds and when CFIA was asked about this “what are you going to do about the 300 Mallard ducks in our field?” they chuckled and said “that’s Wildlife! what are you going to do kill all the wild birds in the world?” well CFIA tell us how the 400 Ostriches hold the key to the survival of the world when they are flightless and we have science that could help! We must find new ways to manage and treat diseases instead of killing immune animals.\nOstrich Antibodies = Groundbreaking Science: Our Ostriches have developed antibodies with the potential to revolutionize how we fight diseases and pandemics. Instead of using this science to help humanity , CFIA wants our healthy immune animals killed.\nOUR LEGAL BATTLE INTENSIFIES\nJudicial Review: April 14-17\nCFIA Submission Deadline end of this week\nCross Examination March 17th – 18th\nThanks to all of your incredible generosity, we have already raised and paid $59,000 in legal fees. However, to continue this battle, we must raise another $41,000 by next week.\nWE NEED YOUR HELP – THIS IS BIGGER THAN ALL OF US\nThis is not just about our farm. If we allow this to continue, Canada and across the world will continue to lose its ability to fight future diseases naturally, and mass culling will keep devastating food security.\nPlease donate, share, and stand with us as we fight for farmers, scientific progress, and the future of ethical farming along with our rights to healthy naturally immune animals being part of our everyday life.\nThank you for your unwavering support! We will not back down\nYou can also go to saveourostriches.com there you will find a link to all our social media platforms.\nRemember helping can be as easy as writing saveourostriches.com in the dirt on your car back window.\nWith love\nOur Family, Our Farm and of course our Ostriches","markdown":"# Mar 6, 2025 Update From the Farm\n\nMarch 6 Herd Immunity is a pretty thing - YouTube\n\n[](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j8dCvhez2j4&embeds_referring_euri=https%3A%2F%2Fsaveourostriches.com%2F)\n\n**URGENT UPDATE – OUR FIGHT FOR JUSTICE CONTINUES**\n\nWe are in the fight of a century to protect our farm (research facility), our animals and the future of farming. The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) is not only pushing for mass culling of our healthy Ostriches (that is based only on 2 PCR tests December 30th) but have continued to threaten us with a $200,000 fine and/ or 6 months in jail if we pursued with 3rd party testing.\n\nThis is a direct attack on transparency and science.\n\n**CRITICAL POINTS YOU NEED TO KNOW:**\n\n*   Only 2 PCR Test: CFIA has only conducted two PCR tests and refuse to re-test our animals despite 51 days of clear health and herd immunity\n*   65 Days in Quarantine: Our Ostriches have remained healthy for nearly 2 months, proving that natural immunity is working\n*   Mass culling is not the answer: The “stamping out” policy that CFIA is relying on to make these decisions is based on outdated trading partner policies that do nothing t advance animal or human health. What the policy IS DOING is wiping out natural immunity, which is the natural resistance and would lead to infectious diseases spreading faster with more devastating effects. No natural immunity in animals would set off a chain reaction leading t the breakdown of ecosystems, food webs, and even human survival.\n*   H5N1 is being spread by migratory birds: This virus is being carried across Canada and the world by migratory birds and when CFIA was asked about this “what are you going to do about the 300 Mallard ducks in our field?” they chuckled and said “that’s Wildlife! what are you going to do kill all the wild birds in the world?” well CFIA tell us how the 400 Ostriches hold the key to the survival of the world when they are flightless and we have science that could help! We must find new ways to manage and treat diseases instead of killing immune animals.\n*   Ostrich Antibodies = Groundbreaking Science: Our Ostriches have developed antibodies with the potential to revolutionize how we fight diseases and pandemics. Instead of using this science to help humanity , CFIA wants our healthy immune animals killed.\n\n**OUR LEGAL BATTLE INTENSIFIES**\n\n*   Judicial Review: April 14-17\n*   CFIA Submission Deadline end of this week\n*   Cross Examination March 17th – 18th\n\nThanks to all of your incredible generosity, we have already raised and paid $59,000 in legal fees. However, to continue this battle, we must raise another $41,000 by next week.\n\n**WE NEED YOUR HELP – THIS IS BIGGER THAN ALL OF US**\n\nThis is not just about our farm. If we allow this to continue, Canada and across the world will continue to lose its ability to fight future diseases naturally, and mass culling will keep devastating food security.\n\nPlease donate, share, and stand with us as we fight for farmers, scientific progress, and the future of ethical farming along with our rights to healthy naturally immune animals being part of our everyday life.\n\nThank you for your unwavering support! We will not back down  \nYou can also go to saveourostriches.com there you will find a link to all our social media platforms.\n\nRemember helping can be as easy as writing saveourostriches.com in the dirt on your car back window.\n\nWith love  \nOur Family, Our Farm and of course our Ostriches","debug":{"requestHandlerMode":"browser"}}

rel=\"alternate\"; title=\"JSON\"; type=\"application/json\", <https://saveourostriches.com/?p=10222>; rel=shortlink","etag":"\"7112-1748140837;br\"","x-litespeed-cache":"hit","content-encoding":"br","vary":"Accept-Encoding","content-length":"24388","date":"Tue, 27 May 2025 06:31:01 GMT","server":"LiteSpeed","platform":"hostinger","panel":"hpanel","content-security-policy":"upgrade-insecure-requests","x-firefox-spdy":"h2"}},"screenshotUrl":null,"text":"Mar 11, 2025 Update From the Farm\nThank you Nicholas Hulscher and the Peter McCullough Foundation for this Focal Points interview and time. We need to rise up and stand together stronger than ever right now. These ostriches stand for so much. \nClick here for interview\nI wanted to provide you all with an update regarding our legal proceedings related to the CFIA affidavits. As you may know, the court has set critical deadlines that we must adhere to in order to effectively advocate for our ostriches.\nCross-Examination Deadline: March 18th\nWritten Argument Deadline: April 1st\nApril 14th to the 17th Judicial Review\nAs many of you know, we are currently facing a challenging situation, as the CFIA has initiated measures that threaten the lives of our hundreds of ostriches that are in their 20s and 30 years of age. They hold decades of genetics and antibodies that can be used to help stabilize viral outbreaks and even treat disease. We believe that with your support, we can successfully challenge these decisions and ensure the safety of our animals and the science to help protect natural immunity.\nOur attorney is actively navigating the legal landscape and defend our rights. However, legal fees are accumulating quickly as this case grows and grows fighting the antics of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency. We need your help to cover these costs and continue our fight. Any contribution, no matter how small, makes a significant difference and brings us closer to our goal.\nHere’s how you can help:\nDonate: If you already have please know how grateful we are as a family and farm and without you we would not be this far and the lives of hundreds of animals still alive.\nSpread the Word: Share our story with friends, family, and other animal lovers. The more awareness we can generate, the stronger our cause will be.\nStay Informed: Follow our updates on social media and our website to stay informed about key developments in our case.\nWe appreciate your unwavering support during this critical time. Together, we can stand up for our ostriches and fight against unjust actions protecting millions of animals that will unnecessarily die by mass culling that is not working. Thank you for your generosity and commitment to this cause.\nBlessings and gratitude to you all, and your continued support and care about this situation. \nOur farm and family are so grateful and of course our Ostriches ️","markdown":"# Mar 11, 2025 Update From the Farm\n\n![](https://saveourostriches.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/25-01-31-thumbnail-1024x768.png)\n\nThank you Nicholas Hulscher and the Peter McCullough Foundation for this Focal Points interview and time. We need to rise up and stand together stronger than ever right now. These ostriches stand for so much.\n\nClick **[here](https://saveourostriches.com/news/canada-orders-mass-culling-of-400-research-ostriches-over-bird-flu-refuses-to-test-surviving-birds-for-natural-immunity/)** for interview\n\nI wanted to provide you all with an update regarding our legal proceedings related to the CFIA affidavits. As you may know, the court has set critical deadlines that we must adhere to in order to effectively advocate for our ostriches.\n\n*   Cross-Examination Deadline: March 18th\n*   Written Argument Deadline: April 1st\n*   April 14th to the 17th Judicial Review\n\nAs many of you know, we are currently facing a challenging situation, as the CFIA has initiated measures that threaten the lives of our hundreds of ostriches that are in their 20s and 30 years of age. They hold decades of genetics and antibodies that can be used to help stabilize viral outbreaks and even treat disease. We believe that with your support, we can successfully challenge these decisions and ensure the safety of our animals and the science to help protect natural immunity.\n\nOur attorney is actively navigating the legal landscape and defend our rights. However, legal fees are accumulating quickly as this case grows and grows fighting the antics of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency. We need your help to cover these costs and continue our fight. Any contribution, no matter how small, makes a significant difference and brings us closer to our goal.\n\n**Here’s how you can help:**\n\n**Donate**: If you already have please know how grateful we are as a family and farm and without you we would not be this far and the lives of hundreds of animals still alive.\n\n**Spread the Word**: Share our story with friends, family, and other animal lovers. The more awareness we can generate, the stronger our cause will be.\n\n**Stay Informed**: Follow our updates on social media and our website to stay informed about key developments in our case.\n\nWe appreciate your unwavering support during this critical time. Together, we can stand up for our ostriches and fight against unjust actions protecting millions of animals that will unnecessarily die by mass culling that is not working. Thank you for your generosity and commitment to this cause.\n\nBlessings and gratitude to you all, and your continued support and care about this situation.\n\nOur farm and family are so grateful and of course our Ostriches ![✨](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/15.1.0/svg/2728.svg)️","debug":{"requestHandlerMode":"browser"}}

However, they spent most of Show more","markdown":"# Feb 26, 2025 Update From the Farm\n\n Feb 26, 2025 – CFIA arrived unannounced with two agents and three RCMP officers in two cruisers. They said they were inspecting the biosecurity area and disposal pile, which was fine because nothing had changed.\n\nKaren Espersen @ Universal Ostrich Farms\n\n**Feb 26, 2025 –** CFIA arrived unannounced with two agents and three RCMP officers in two cruisers. They said they were inspecting the biosecurity area and disposal pile, which was fine because nothing had changed.\n\nHowever, they spent most of the time looking at our fences and the empty fenced in area without ostriches. It seemed obvious to us that they were mapping out our property, but for what purpose?\n\nWe were also told that after 57 days under quarantine and 43 days with healthy animals, we’ll need a daily permit to move around our property with our personal feed chore truck. This seems unreasonable, as we already follow strict quarantine measures, and the truck is sanitized daily.\n\nPlease help us by donating and continuing to share our story! rel=\"alternate\"; title=\"JSON\"; type=\"application/json\", <https://saveourostriches.com/?p=10208>; rel=shortlink","etag":"\"7049-1748067478;br\"","x-litespeed-cache":"hit","content-encoding":"br","vary":"Accept-Encoding","content-length":"24415","date":"Tue, 27 May 2025 06:31:19 GMT","server":"LiteSpeed","platform":"hostinger","panel":"hpanel","content-security-policy":"upgrade-insecure-requests","x-firefox-spdy":"h2"}},"screenshotUrl":null,"text":"Feb 27, 2025 Update From the Farm\nTo the public and all our current supporters,\nWe are reaching out to you with a plea for urgent support in our legal battle against the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA), which is threatening to destroy something that could change the future of medicine as we know it.\nAt stake are the lives of hundreds of ostriches that have developed antibodies with the potential to revolutionize how we treat diseases and viruses. Rather than taking this groundbreaking science into account to help stabilize possible new and existing pandemic threats, the CFIA is relying on outdated trading partner policies that do nothing to advance human or animal health. Their approach ignores the vital role of natural immunity in protecting against disease, and worse yet, it contributes to the ongoing failure of mass culling polices that have done nothing but weaken the global immunity in animals and challenge our food supply.\nThe science is clear: culling is not working. By wiping out natural immunity in animals, we are eliminating natures most powerful defense system – one that has allowed species (including humans) to survive for millions of years. If natural immunity in animals is lost, the consequences will be catastrophic for the entire planet. Think about this every new disease will be met with nothing but fear, mass slaughter, and further destruction, leaving us more vulnerable than ever. What happens when we eradicate the very thing that nature designed to protect us?\nWe have to stop this reckless approach before it’s too late. We are fighting for a future where science, not outdated policies, determines the course of action.\nWe need your help – whether through public awareness i.e.: signs on cars, yard signs, call your local media, purchasing Save Our Ostriches merchandise and wearing it, donations towards our legal battle, or simply sharing the message.\nStand with us in demanding CFIA recognize the value of natural immunity and put science before bureaucracy. If we do not act now, we risk losing not only these ostriches but also a breakthrough that could save lives and generations to come, with the opportunity to make Canada healthy again and the world healthy again.\nPlease join us in this fight to protect all our animals, our farms, and the future of medicine and natural immunity.\nThank you to all of you who have been part of our journey this far, our family our farm and our animals have made it this far because our strength together.\nWe can not slow down now! Time to ramp up the fight and share, speak out, and send images in of how you are supporting this movement.\nMany blessings\nKatie and Karen\nFebruary 27, 2025 - YouTube","markdown":"# Feb 27, 2025 Update From the Farm\n\n![](https://saveourostriches.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/25-02-27-image-1024x768.png)\n\nTo the public and all our current supporters,\n\nWe are reaching out to you with a plea for urgent support in our legal battle against the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA), which is threatening to destroy something that could change the future of medicine as we know it.\n\n**At stake are the lives of hundreds of ostriches** that have developed antibodies with the potential to revolutionize how we treat diseases and viruses. Rather than taking this groundbreaking science into account to help stabilize possible new and existing pandemic threats, the CFIA is relying on outdated trading partner policies that do nothing to advance human or animal health. Their approach ignores the vital role of natural immunity in protecting against disease, and worse yet, it contributes to the ongoing failure of mass culling polices that have done nothing but weaken the global immunity in animals and challenge our food supply.\n\n**The science is clear: culling is not working.** By wiping out natural immunity in animals, we are eliminating natures most powerful defense system – one that has allowed species (including humans) to survive for millions of years. If natural immunity in animals is lost, the consequences will be catastrophic for the entire planet. Think about this every new disease will be met with nothing but fear, mass slaughter, and further destruction, leaving us more vulnerable than ever. What happens when we eradicate the very thing that nature designed to protect us?\n\nWe have to stop this reckless approach before it’s too late. We are fighting for a future where science, not outdated policies, determines the course of action.\n\n**We need your help** – whether through public awareness i.e.: signs on cars, yard signs, call your local media, purchasing Save Our Ostriches merchandise and wearing it, donations towards our legal battle, or simply sharing the message.\n\n**Stand with us** in demanding CFIA recognize the value of natural immunity and put science before bureaucracy. If we do not act now, we risk losing not only these ostriches but also a breakthrough that could save lives and generations to come, with the opportunity to make Canada healthy again and the world healthy again.\n\n**Please join us** in this fight to protect all our animals, our farms, and the future of medicine and natural immunity.\n\n**Thank you** to all of you who have been part of our journey this far, our family our farm and our animals have made it this far because our strength together.\n\nWe can not slow down now! Time to ramp up the fight and share, speak out, and send images in of how you are supporting this movement.\n\nMany blessings  \nKatie and Karen\n\nFebruary 27, 2025 - YouTube\n\n[](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nGFe6Khcwmc&embeds_referring_euri=https%3A%2F%2Fsaveourostriches.com%2F)","debug":{"requestHandlerMode":"browser"}}
